Submodules¶

faulttolerance.decomposition.circuit module¶

Wrapper functions to put together circuits involved in the process of making GHZ states out of entangled Bell pairs. Must be used with ‘circuit_block.py’

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 20/11/17

class faulttolerance.decomposition.circuit.Circuit(a0, a1, circuit_block, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Class to hold a block in the overall GHZ state formation protocol. Subcircuit object for the circuit that goes inside this block.

Circuits are assembled using recursive objects and circuit blocks. After each level with a success probability a number of attempts is calculated and used to evaluate the time it required unit success. Similar to an event oriented simulation.

add_circuit(circuit_block, **kwargs)¶

Add a circuit to the current circuit chain.

cicuit_block : (Blocks) function from circuit_block.py to be evaluated
in a step of the circuit

**kwargs : arguments for evaluating the cicuit_block

append_circuit(rho=None)¶

Appended circuit, and depolarize accordingly. Must be self contained event

rho : (densmat) density matrix involved in the circuit, can be None depending
on the circuit block
run()¶

Main function to run circuits recurively.

rho : (densmat) density matrix involved in the circuit, can be None depending
on the circuit block
run_as_block(rho=None)¶

Run circuit as a block. This function is used to wrap circuits and run them as blocks in order to append them to another circuit.

rho : (densmat) density matrix involved in the circuit, can be None depending
on the circuit block
run_parallel(rho=None, parallel=2)¶

Run circuit three times in parallel, tensoring the resulting states, and dephasing the one that was generated first accordingly. Cicuits must be self contained events to be able to run in parallel.

rho : (densmat) density matrix involved in the circuit, can be None depending
on the circuit block

parallel : (int) number of executions in parallel of the circuit

start(rho=None)¶

Star the first element of the circuit. Must be self contained event

rho : (densmat) density matrix involved in the circuit, can be None depending
on the circuit block

faulttolerance.decomposition.circuit_block module¶

Individual circuits involved the remote generation of entanglement and in different steps of purification protocols. Must be used together with ‘circuit.py’ to assemeble complete circuits.

Includes features to keep track of how many operations and time has passed after each circuit.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 20/11/17

class faulttolerance.decomposition.circuit_block.Blocks(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta)¶

Bases: object

Class for holding all protocols. Each circuit block returns the resulting state, number of steps used and the probability of success if applicable.

add_bell_pair(rho)¶

Append a single click Bell pair to the state.

rho : (densmat) density matrix in which the bell pair appends.

change_parameters(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta)¶

Function to change the parameters of all the operations.

ps : (scalar) single qubit gate error rate. pm : (scalar) measurement error rate. pg : (scalar) two qubit gate error rate. eta : (scalar) detection efficiency. a0 : (scalar) extra environmental error when electron spin is being operated. a1 : (scalar) default environmental error. theta : (scalar) determines how the states are initialized when generating remote

entanglement.
collapse_ancillas_GHZ(rho, ghz_size, measure_pos)¶

Collapse the ancillas in the nodes to create a GHZ state. In the ghz_4 connected through 4 pairs then the ancillas must be the last qubit(s)

rho : (densmat) density matrix ghz_size : (int) size of the GHZ state being formed, must be 3 or 4 measure_pos : (int) list with the positions of ancillas to be measured

collapse_ancillas_X(rho, ancillas_pos, projections)¶

Measure the ancillas in the X basis in parallel in each node. Ancillas position need to be the last part of the state.

rho : (densmat) density matrix ancillas_pos : (int) list with the positions of ancillas to be measured projections : (list) list with the projections in which every ancilla collapses

collapse_ancillas_Z(rho, ancillas_pos, projections)¶

Measure the ancillas in the X basis in parallel in each node. Ancillas position need to be the last part of the state.

rho : (densmat) density matrix ancillas_pos : (int) list with the positions of ancillas to be measured projections : (list) list with the projections in which every ancilla collapses

double_selection(rho, operation_qubits, sigma)¶

Double selection round. Uses 4 ancilla qubits.

rho : (densmat) density matrix operation_pos : (list) list with the positions of the qubits to be purified

by the protocol

sigma : (string) X or Z parity used in the purification

double_selection22(sigma)¶

Double selection round. Uses 4 ancilla qubits.

rho : (densmat) density matrix operation_pos : (list) list with the positions of the qubits to be purified

by the protocol

sigma : (string) X or Z parity used in the purification

double_selection_ops(rho, targets, ancillas1, ancillas2, sigma)¶

Double selection round. Uses 4 ancilla qubits.

rho : (densmat) density matrix operation_pos : (list) list with the positions of the qubits to be purified

by the protocol

sigma : (string) X or Z parity used in the purification

single_selection(rho, operation_qubits, sigma)¶

Single selection round. Uses 2 ancilla qubits.

rho : (densmat) density matrix operation_pos : (list) list with the positions of the qubits to be purified

by the protocol

sigma : (string) X or Z parity used in the purification

single_selection_ops(rho, targets, ancillas, sigma)¶

Single selection round. Uses 2 ancilla qubits.

rho : (densmat) density matrix targets : (list) list with the positions of the qubits to be purified

by the protocol

ancillas : (list) list with the positions of the ancilla qubits sigma : (string) X or Z parity used in the purification

start_BK(rho=None)¶

Circuit that generates a Bell pair from the Barret-Kok protocol.

NOTE: rho is not taken from arguments, only exists due to how ‘circuit.py’ is constructed.

start_bell_pair(rho=None)¶

Start with a raw Bell pair using the single click protocol.

NOTE: rho is not taken from arguments, only exists due to how ‘circuit.py’ is constructed.

1, check list, bell state : int, Collections.Counter, qutip.Qobj

start_epl(rho=None)¶

Circuit that generates a Bell pair using the EPL protocol.

NOTE: rho is not taken from arguments, only exists due to how ‘circuit.py’ is constructed.

swap_pair(rho, pair)¶

Does not really make a SWAP, only applies the noise. Position of states in each node must be keep track manually.

rho : (densmat) density matrix pair : (list) pair of qubits to be swaped ex. [2, 3]

two_qubit_gates(rho, controls, targets, sigma)¶

Apply one local two qubit Control type of gates in parallel on each node.

rho : (densmat) density matrix controls : (list) list with the control qubits position targets : (list) list with the target qubits position sigma : (string) X or Z depending on the gate

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models module¶

Error models used to simulate the decoherence effects due to imperfect operations.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 05/06/17

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.bell_pair(p)¶

Return a noisy |phi+> Bell pair of the form $(1-p)*Phi^{+} + p/3 * ( Phi^{-} + Psi^{+} + Psi^{-})$

p : (scalar) error rate

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.bell_pair_click(eta, theta)¶

Return a Bell pair generated using the single click protocol. Initial qubits are initialized in the states: sin(theta)|0> + cos(theta)|1>

eta : ???
(scalar) detection efficiency
theta : ???
(scalar) determines how the initial qubits are initialized

Qobj (QuTip object)???

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.bell_pair_psi(p)¶

Return a noisy |psi+> Bell pair of the form $(1-p)*Phi^{+} + p/3 * ( Phi^{-} + Psi^{+} + Psi^{-})$

p : (scalar) error rate

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.drift(state, pd)¶

Drift noise according to NN article.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.env_error(rho, a0, a1, t, N, qubits)¶

Apply environmental error on the selected qubits from the list.

rho : (densmat) the state to be dephased. a0 : (scalar) depolarizing effect due to the entanglement generation attemts. a1 : (scalar) depolarizing due to the environment interactions. t : (scalar) time in wich the dephasing ocurrs. N : (int) total size of the system qubits : (list) list with the qubits on which the error applies

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.env_error_all(rho, a0, a1, t)¶

Apply environtmental dephasing on all qubits in the state rho.

rho : (densmat) the state to be dephased. a0 : (scalar) dephaising effect due to the entanglement generation attemts. a1 : (scalar) dephasing due to the environment interactions. t : (scalar) time in wich the dephasing ocurrs.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.env_error_single(rho, a0, a1, t, N=1, pos=0)¶

Apply environmental error on a single qubit from the state rho.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.generate_noisy_ghz(F, N)¶

Generate a noisy GHZ state of a given fidelity.

F : (scalar) fidelity of the final state N : (int) size of the final GHZ

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.get_sigmas(N=1, pos=0)¶

Return set of single qubit X Y Z gates.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.measure_single_Xbasis_forced(rho, p, project, N=1, pos=0)¶

Collapse the state on the given position and to the given projector.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.measure_single_Xbasis_random(rho, p, N=1, pos=0)¶

Probabilisticly measure and collapse the state on the given position.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.measure_single_Zbasis_forced(rho, p, project, N=1, pos=0)¶

Collapse the state on the given position and to the given projector.

rho : (densmat) the state to apply the noisy gate on p : (scalar) measurement error rate project : (scalar) 0 or 1, projector involved in the measurement collapse N : (int) total system size pos : (int) position of the qubit to be measured

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.measure_single_Zbasis_random(rho, p, N=1, pos=0)¶

Probabilisticly measure and collapse the state on the given position.

rho : (densmat) the state to apply the noisy gate on p : (scalar) measurement error rate N : (int) total system size pos : (int) position of the qubit to be measured

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.single_qubit_gate(rho, gate, p, N=1, pos=0)¶

Apply a single qubit with the corresponding noise.

rho : (densmat) the state to apply the noisy gate on gate : (operator) ideal gate to be applied p : (scalar) error rate N : (int) total system size pos : (int) position of the qubit in which the gate applies

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.single_qubit_gate_noise(rho, p, N=1, pos=0)¶

Apply depolarizing noise due a single qubit operation.

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.two_qubit_gate(rho, gate, p, N=2, pos1=0, pos2=1)¶

Apply a two quit gate with its corresponding noise.

rho : (densmat) the state to apply the noisy gate on gate : (operator) ideal gate to be applied p : (scalar) error rate N : (int) total system size pos1 : (int) position of the first qubit in which the gate applies pos2 : (int) position of the second qubit in which the gate applies

faulttolerance.decomposition.error_models.two_qubit_gate_noise(rho, p, N=2, pos1=0, pos2=1)¶

Depolarizing noise due to a noisy two qubit gate.

faulttolerance.decomposition.protocols module¶

Functions with the different protocols for generating a GHZ state. They rely on circuit.py and circuit_block.py to enssemble the circuit that generates the GHZ. Each function returns a circuit object that must be executed to obtain a GHZ.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 21/11/17

faulttolerance.decomposition.protocols.ghz2_bk(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta)¶

GHZ state of weigth 2 created using 2 Bell pairs generated using the double selection protocol.

ps : (scalar) single qubit gate error rate. pm : (scalar) measurement error rate. pg : (scalar) two qubit gate error rate. eta : (scalar) detection efficiency. a0 : (scalar) extra environmental error when electron spin is being operated. a1 : (scalar) default environmental error. theta : (scalar) determines how the states are initialized when generating remote

entanglement.
faulttolerance.decomposition.protocols.ghz2_double(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta)¶

GHZ state of weigth 2 created using 2 Bell pairs generated using the double selection protocol.

entanglement.

faulttolerance.decomposition.stabilizer module¶

Routines for measuring stabilizers in a local system or in a disitributed one by means of GHZ states.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 05/02/18

class faulttolerance.decomposition.stabilizer.Stabilizer(ps, pm, pg)¶

Bases: object

Class for holding functions relevant to making stabilizer measurements

apply_two_qubit_gates(rho, N, controls, targets, sigma)¶

Apply a series of two qubit Control type of gates.

rho : (densmat) density matrix N : (int) total system size controls : (list) list with the control qubits position targets : (list) list with the target qubits position sigma : (string) X or Z depending on the gate

change_parameters(ps, pm, pg)¶

Function to change the parameters of all the operations.

ps : (scalar) single qubit gate error rate. pm : (scalar) measurement error rate. pg : (scalar) two qubit gate error rate.

collapse_ancillas_forced(rho, N, N_ancillas, projections)¶

Measure the ancillas in the X basis. Ancillas position need to be the last part of the state.

rho : (densmat) density matrix N : (int) total system size N_ancillas : (int) number of ancillas to be measured projections : (list) list with the projections in which every ancilla collapses

generate_noisy_plus()¶

Generate single noisy qubit in the |+> state.

get_two_qubit_gates(N, controls, targets, sigma)¶

Construct two qubit Control type of gates.

local_stabilizer(rho, parity_targets, stabilizer)¶

Perform a local stabilizer measurement. Uses 4 data qubits and 1 ancillas.

rho : (densmat) state to be measured by the stabilizer parity_targets : (list) positions of the qubits to be measured stabilizer : (string) star or plaquette

measure_ghz_stabilizer(rho, ghz, parity_targets, stabilizer)¶

Measure a stabilizer through a GHZ state. Size of the GHZ equals the number of qubits measured through the stabilizer.

rho : (densmat) state to be measured by the stabilizer ghz : (densmat) GHZ state to be used in the stabilizer measurement parity_targets : (list) positions of the qubits to be measured stabilizer : (string) star or plaquette

measure_single_forced(rho, N, pos, project, basis)¶

Measure a single qubit in the state. Dimension is reduced after collapse

twirl_ghz(ghz)¶

Twirl the GHZ state to disitribute error uniformly. Twirling is made trough averaging through permutation of all qubits in the GHZ.

ghz : (densmat) density matrix of a ghz state.

faulttolerance.decomposition.test_circuit_block module¶

Test file for the functions on Circuit Block.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 20/11/17

class faulttolerance.decomposition.test_circuit_block.Test_Blocks(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

static check_close(threshold, val1, val2)¶
check_perfect_case(bell_generate_function, state)¶

state should be one of [‘00’, ‘01’, ‘10’, ‘11’]

static get_noiseless_blocks()¶
static get_perfect_bell_pair(state)¶

state should be one of [‘00’, ‘01’, ‘10’, ‘11’]

setUp()¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_change_parameters()¶
test_generate_bell_pair_BK()¶
test_generate_bell_single_click()¶
test_init()¶
test_start_bell_pair()¶
test_success_number_of_attempts()¶

The function Blocks._success_number_of_attempts samples from the CDF of the geometric distribution.
